intro: Pimpinella saxifraga f. triangularis, commonly known as the triangular cow-wheat, is a variant of the cow-wheat species native to Europe. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically triangular in shape, giving it its specific epithet. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species within its native range.
